metadata.title: CVE-2019-11724 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Application permissions give additional remote troubleshooting permission to the site input.mozilla.org, which has been retired and now redirects to another site. This additional permission is unnecessary and is a potential vector for malicious attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11724` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
